main event: On 8 March 1956, a civilian observed a round object, similar in size to the moon, flying from the horizon with a buzzing sound. The object then faded and landed after approximately three minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as white to pink in color and emitted a buzzing sound.
It flew in a straight line course from the west to the east before fading and landing.
The report indicates that it was unclear whether the object was a balloon or an aircraft, and the conclusion was 'Unknown' due to insufficient data.
The observer was a 33-year-old civilian named George Eggd from Winchester, California.
The observation lasted for 15-20 minutes and includes detailed altitude and speed measurements of the object as it traveled from 3,323 ft to 55,222 ft.
sighted object: a round object, similar in size to the moon, emitting a buzzing sound
